Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Annulment \An*nul"ment\, n. [Cf. F. annulement.] The act of annulling; abolition; invalidation. [1913 Webster]

annulment n 1: the state of being cancelled or annulled [syn: {revocation}] 2: (law) a formal termination (of a relationship or a judicial proceeding etc) [syn: {invalidation}] 3: the act of abrogating; an official or legal cancellation [syn: {abrogation}, {repeal}]
